column2: For each reaction, add the following components to a PCR tube (total volume should be 50 _l):  23 _l DNA from step 27, 1 _l Illumina PCR primer 1.1, 1 _l Illumina PCR primer 2.1, 25 _l of 2× Phusion DNA polymerase master mix.

column5: Output from prior protocol (Illumina, Ligate Illumina Adapters)
Nucleic Acid, Primer, Illumina PCR primer 1.1
Nucleic Acid, Primer, Illumina PCR primer 2.1
Enzyme Mix, Phusion DNA Polymerase Master Mix, 2X

column2: Mix gently by pipetting up and down. Try to avoid creation of bubbles.
column5: gently by pipetting up and down
try to avoid creation of bubbles.

column2: centrifuge briefly to collect the solution in the bottom of the tube.

column5: to collect the solution in the bottom of the tube.

column2: Place the tubes in the thermal cycler and perform the following thermal cycling program: 1 cycle: 30 sec 98_C (initial denaturation), 15 cycles: 10 sec 98_C (denaturation), 30 sec 65_C (annealing), 30 sec 72_C (extension), 1 cycle: 5 min 72_C (final extension). The cycling conditions may need to be optimized, but these above are reasonable starting conditions.
column5: The cycling conditions may need to be optimized, but these are reasonable starting conditions.

column2: Purify the PCR product using the QIAquick MinElute PCR Purification Kit. Follow the manufacturer's recommended protocol, but elute in a final volume of 15 _l of Buffer EB. Note that this step again uses the MinElute version of the kit.
